  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands">MipsConstantIslands</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands">MipsConstantIslands</a> - Due to limited PC-relative displacements, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/mips">Mips</a> requires constant pool entries to be scattered among the instructions inside a function. <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/basicblockinfo">BasicBlockInfo</a></>}>
<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/basicblockinfo">BasicBlockInfo</a> - Information about the offset and size of a single basic block. <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/basicblockinfo/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/cpuser">CPUser</a></>}>
CPUser - One user of a constant pool, keeping the machine instruction pointer, the constant pool being referenced, and the max displacement allowed from the instruction to the CP. <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/cpuser/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/cpentry">CPEntry</a></>}>
CPEntry - One per constant pool entry, keeping the machine instruction pointer, the constpool index, and the number of CPUser&#39;s which reference this entry. <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/cpentry/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="struct"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/immbranch">ImmBranch</a></>}>
ImmBranch - One per immediate branch, keeping the machine instruction pointer, conditional or unconditional, the max displacement, and (if isCond is true) the corresponding unconditional branch opcode. <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/immbranch/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This pass is used to make Pc relative loads of constants.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For now, only Mips16 will use this.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Loading constants inline is expensive on Mips16 and it&#39;s in general better</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to place the constant nearby in code space and then it can be loaded with a</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// simple 16 bit load instruction.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The constants can be not just numbers but addresses of functions and labels.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This can be particularly helpful in static relocation mode for embedded</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// non-linux targets.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MipsConstantIslands - Due to limited PC-relative displacements, Mips</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// requires constant pool entries to be scattered among the instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// inside a function.  To do this, it completely ignores the normal LLVM</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// constant pool; instead, it places constants wherever it feels like with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// special instructions.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The terminology used in this pass includes:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="194"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Islands - Clumps of constants placed in the function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="195"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Water   - Potential places where an island could be formed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="196"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   CPE     - A constant pool entry that has been placed somewhere, which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///             tracks a list of users.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#aa5de99ed1dd179bee53f782e65658825">MipsConstantIslands</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunctionpass/#a29c81d2386f4a727c6d33413807530c8">MachineFunctionPass</a> &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// BasicBlockInfo - Information about the offset and size of a single</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// basic block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">BasicBlockInfo &#123;</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// Offset - Distance from the beginning of the function to the beginning</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// of this basic block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="comment">      ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// Offsets are computed assuming worst case padding before an aligned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// block. This means that subtracting basic block offsets always gives a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// conservative estimate of the real distance which may be smaller.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="comment">      ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// Because worst case padding is used, the computed offset of an aligned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// block may not actually be aligned.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// Size - Size of the basic block in bytes.  If the block contains</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// inline assembly, this is a worst case estimate.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="comment">      ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// The size does not include any alignment padding whether from the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// beginning of the block, or from an aligned jump table at the end.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal">      BasicBlockInfo() = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">default</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> postOffset()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a> + <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="normal">    std::vector&lt;BasicBlockInfo&gt; BBInfo;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// WaterList - A sorted list of basic blocks where islands could be placed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// (i.e. blocks that don&#39;t fall through to the following block, due</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// to a return, unreachable, or unconditional branch).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="normal">    std::vector&lt;MachineBasicBlock&#42;&gt; WaterList;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// NewWaterList - The subset of WaterList that was created since the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// previous iteration by inserting unconditional branches.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallset">SmallSet&lt;MachineBasicBlock&#42;, 4&gt;</a> NewWaterList;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">water&#95;iterator = std::vector&lt;MachineBasicBlock &#42;&gt;::iterator;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// CPUser - One user of a constant pool, keeping the machine instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// pointer, the constant pool being referenced, and the max displacement</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// allowed from the instruction to the CP.  The HighWaterMark records the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// highest basic block where a new CPEntry can be placed.  To ensure this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// pass terminates, the CP entries are initially placed at the end of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// function and then move monotonically to lower addresses.  The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// exception to this rule is when the current CP entry for a particular</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// CPUser is out of range, but there is another CP entry for the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// constant value in range.  We want to use the existing in-range CP</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// entry, but if it later moves out of range, the search for new water</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// should resume where it left off.  The HighWaterMark is used to record</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="comment">    /// that point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">CPUser &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;CPEMI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock">MachineBasicBlock</a> &#42;HighWaterMark;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><Highlight kind="normal">             </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad137f00752c91478230b01c851768605">neg</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"><Highlight kind="normal">        HighWaterMark = CPEMI-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr/#a1e855100f407ca4be098d0050be403b0">getParent</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><Highlight kind="normal">      &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">      /// getMaxDisp - Returns the maximum displacement supported by MI.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> getMaxDisp()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><Highlight kind="comment">/// findConstPoolEntry - Given the constpool index and CONSTPOOL&#95;ENTRY MI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><Highlight kind="comment">/// look up the corresponding CPEntry.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><Highlight kind="normal">MipsConstantIslands::CPEntry</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="600" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#a1a421414700d8d58b412a7e067cb02ad"><Highlight kind="normal">&#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#a1a421414700d8d58b412a7e067cb02ad">MipsConstantIslands::findConstPoolEntry</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CPI,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="601"><Highlight kind="normal">                                        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;CPEMI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="602"><Highlight kind="normal">  std::vector&lt;CPEntry&gt; &amp;CPEs = CPEntries&#91;CPI&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#af8551cd00faa264bb137701056f6f3d0">MipsConstantIslands::isOffsetInRange</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UserOffset,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// User before the Trial.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="comment">/// isWaterInRange - Returns true if a CPE placed after the specified</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Compute how much the function will grow by inserting a CPE after Water.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><Highlight kind="normal">    NextBlockOffset = BBInfo&#91;Water-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a3aa22d521bd6a7e6b9f35545dc7b0f1e">getNumber</a>()&#93;.postOffset();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><Highlight kind="normal">    NextBlockOffset = BBInfo&#91;NextBlock-&gt;getNumber()&#93;.Offset;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> = U.CPEMI-&gt;getOperand(2).getImm();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CPEEnd = CPEOffset + <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The CPE may be able to hide in the alignment padding before the next</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block. It may also cause more padding to be required if it is more aligned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that the next block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CPEEnd &gt; NextBlockOffset) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="normal">    Growth = CPEEnd - NextBlockOffset;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Compute the padding that would go at the end of the CPE to align the next</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="normal">    Growth += <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a99cdcecbadc13087f087c61809bb44f1">offsetToAlignment</a>(CPEEnd, NextBlockAlignment);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the CPE is to be inserted before the instruction, that will raise</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the offset of the instruction. Also account for unknown alignment padding</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// in blocks between CPE and the user.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00955" /><CodeLine lineNumber="955"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (CPEOffset &lt; UserOffset)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00956" /><CodeLine lineNumber="956"><Highlight kind="normal">      UserOffset += Growth;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00957" /><CodeLine lineNumber="957"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00958" /><CodeLine lineNumber="958"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// CPE fits in existing padding.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00959" /><CodeLine lineNumber="959"><Highlight kind="normal">    Growth = 0;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><Highlight kind="comment">/// findAvailableWater - Look for an existing entry in the WaterList in which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><Highlight kind="comment">/// we can place the CPE referenced from U so it&#39;s within range of U&#39;s MI.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Returns true if found, false if not.  If it returns true, WaterIter</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1155"><Highlight kind="comment">/// is set to the WaterList entry.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="comment">/// To ensure that this pass</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><Highlight kind="comment">/// terminates, the CPE location for a particular CPUser is only allowed to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="comment">/// move to a lower address, so search backward from the end of the list and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="comment">/// prefer the first water that is in range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#a909a324ed32517aaca69fb2e87f41bca"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-mipsconstantislandpass-cpp-/mipsconstantislands/#a909a324ed32517aaca69fb2e87f41bca">MipsConstantIslands::findAvailableWater</a>(CPUser &amp;U, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UserOffset,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (water&#95;iterator IP = std::prev(WaterList.end()), <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/builtingcs-cpp/#ae76959fe811ba090de4cba69ac00f1da">B</a> = WaterList.begin();;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><Highlight kind="normal">       --IP) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check if water is in range and is either at a lower address than the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// current &quot;high water mark&quot; or a new water block that was created since</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the previous iteration by inserting an unconditional branch.  In the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// latter case, we want to allow resetting the high water mark back to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// this new water since we haven&#39;t seen it before.  Inserting branches</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><Highlight kind="comment">/// createNewWater - No existing WaterList entry will work for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><Highlight kind="comment">/// CPUsers&#91;CPUserIndex&#93;, so create a place to put the CPE.  The end of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block is used if in range, and the conditional branch munged so control</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// flow is correct.  Otherwise the block is split to create a hole with an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// unconditional branch around it.  In either case NewMBB is set to a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="comment">/// block following which the new island can be inserted (the WaterList</Highlight></CodeLine>
